title: Employing staff for the first time

details.description: The main things you need to consider when hiring an employee for the first time or if you've never hired an employee before
details.body:
There are 5 things you need to do when employing staff for the first time.

  1. Decide how much you need to pay someone: you must pay your employee at least the National Minimum Wage (NMW).

  2. Check if someone can legally work for you: you need to check if they have the legal right to work in the UK. You may have to do other employment checks as well.

  3. Get employment insurance: you need employers’ liability insurance as soon as you become an employer. It must cover you for at least £5 million and come from an ‘authorised insurer’ - you can find one online.

  4. Register with HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) and pay your employee: you need to register as an employer, make any deductions (ie PAYE and National Insurance contributions) and give a pay statement to your employee.

  5. Send details of the job (including terms and conditions) in writing to your employee: if you’re employing someone for more than a month, you need to give them a written statement of employment within their first 2 months.

Download ‘Template for a written statement of employment’ (PDF, 628KB)

Read the HMRC booklet below for advice on taking on your first employee.

Download ‘Employing someone for the first time’ (PDF, 183KB)
